docs.snippet: In its opening game, Rick Pitino’s Louisville will meet Manhattan, coached by a former assistant, Steve Masiello, who knows Pitino’s game intimately....
docs.lead_paragraph: In its opening game, Rick Pitino’s Louisville will meet Manhattan, coached by a former assistant, Steve Masiello, who knows Pitino’s game intimately.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of the Times column; Rick Pitino is dismayed to learn that his Louisville team, in its opening game in NCAA tournament, will play Manhattan College under coach Steve Masiello; observes that Masiello, who was his former assistant, knows Pitino's game intimately.

headline.main: Everywhere Pitino Looks at N.C.A.A. Tournament, There’s Another Protégé

docs.snippet: When he was an assistant coach at U.C.L.A. in 1994, Mark Gottfried watched the Bruins lose to Tulsa. Now, a 12th-seeded team ousting a No. 5 seed has become almost an annual occurrence....
docs.lead_paragraph: When he was an assistant coach at U.C.L.A. in 1994, Mark Gottfried watched the Bruins lose to Tulsa. Now, a 12th-seeded team ousting a No. 5 seed has become almost an annual occurrence.
docs.abstract: It has become an almost annual occurrence for 12th-seeded basketball teams in NCAA tournament to defeat No 5 seeds; such victories have evolved from being considered an upset to a dramatic expectation that has become key part of strategy in filling out tournament brackets.

headline.main: Coach Gets a New View of a Notorious Seeding
headline.print_headline: In 5 vs. 12, Surprise Has Become the Norm

docs.lead_paragraph: The Knicks’ choice of Phil Jackson as their savior sets up an unusual family dynamic: His fiancée, Jeanie Buss, runs a team on the opposite coast.
docs.abstract: New York Knicks’ choice of Phil Jackson as president could create tension within Jackson's family, since his fiancee, Jeanie Buss, runs the Los Angeles Lakers on the opposite coast.

headline.main: For Knicks’ Jackson, Lakers’ Buss Is Companion and Competition
